meanings.definition: A unit of currency in Uzbekistan.
meanings.sent1: In Uzbekistan, you can buy many things with just one kas.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for kas when I visited Uzbekistan.
meanings.sent3: The market vendor only accepted kas, so I had to find an exchange shop.
meanings.sent4: To him, money was just pieces of paper, but to me, each kas held value.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kas coins jingled in my pocket as I walked.

meanings.definition: A type of traditional Indian dance.
meanings.sent1: She performed a beautiful kas at the cultural festival.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved gracefully to the rhythm of the kas music.
meanings.sent3: During the kas, she accidentally stepped on her partner's foot, causing a giggle from the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her movements in the kas were like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of their costumes added to the magic of the kas performance.

meanings.definition: A type of shrub native to South Africa.
meanings.sent1: The kas plant bloomed with colorful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The leaves of the kas shrub provided shade from the hot African sun.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkeys loved to climb the kas tree and steal its berries.
meanings.sent4: The fragrance of the kas bush filled the air with a sweet aroma.
meanings.sent5: The thorns on the kas branches protected it from hungry animals.
